Key Match Events: The Tigers beat the White Sox to improve to 86-74 and ensure that, at the very least, they will have the third and final wild card spot.
Riley Greene doubled off the wall in dead center to make it 3-1, and another wild pitch made it 4-1.
Pre-Game Insights: The Tigers have done nothing but win over the past 40 games. More specifically, they’re an unfathomable 31-11 since Aug. 10.
The Tigers are 54-26 in games Meadows played in this season.
Post-Match Reflections: The Tigers have ended their playoff drought, but that doesn’t mean they can’t make more noise in the postseason.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers are going back to the playoffs after a 10-year drought.
The Tigers have won 32 of their last 43 games -- the same Tigers who were 55-63 and sold at the deadline!
